sentence.text: Among 510 unrelated patients with distal motor neuropathy, we identified mutations in HSPB1 (28 index patients/510; 5.5%) and cellular response to unfolded protein (four index patients/510; 0.8%) genes.

In this study, we describe the phenotypic spectrum of distal hereditary motor neuropathy caused by mutations in the small heat shock proteins HSPB1 and cellular response to unfolded protein and investigate the functional consequences of newly discovered variants.
We demonstrate that HSPB1 and cellular response to unfolded protein mutations are a major cause of inherited motor axonal neuropathy.
